Others: The match will take place on November 9, 2023, at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.
New Zealand needs to win this game to stay in the semi-finals race.
Sri Lanka have already been eliminated from the competition.
The match will start at 2:00 p.m. I.S.T (08:30 AM G.M.T) on November 9 (Thursday).
The International Cricket Council (ICC) has granted Disney+ Hotstar digital rights to the event.
The game will be televised on Star Sports Networks and its regional networks in various languages.
Live streaming is accessible in the United States via the ESPN+ app and the WillowTV channel.
Australians will get access to Fox Sports and Kayo.
The SuperSport network in 52 Sub-Saharan African nations, including South Africa, will show live coverage of the NZ vs SL match.
Sky Sports New Zealand will broadcast the upcoming match.
The match will be broadcast live on STARZPLAY across the Middle East and North Africa, as well as CricLife MAX in the UAE.
